$description:
| What does this do? | Publishes sensitivity label policies in Microsoft Purview so labels are available to classify and protect content across Microsoft 365. |
| Why should you use this? | Enables consistent classification and enforcement (encryption, access restrictions, watermarks, and auto-labeling) to reduce the risk of data loss, support regulatory compliance, and improve visibility and control over sensitive information. |
| What is the end-user impact? | Users may see labels in Office apps and may experience access restrictions or encryption when interacting with labeled content. Labels should be tested and deployed carefully. |
| Learn more | [Sensitivity labels](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/sensitivity-labels) |

Settings.Value:
Highly confidential data is intended only for an extremely restricted group of people in accordance with the 'need-to-know' principle. The users of this information must be named. Transmission or forwarding is also only to named recipients and requires the consent of the person responsible for the information.

[Note]:
A leak of this data would cause considerable damage to the company! 

[Examples]:
Information that enables access to or sabotage of customer data and infrastructures Information about business strategy or important company developments (e.g., planning data)
Own as well as customer-related security-relevant data such as passwords, private PGP keys, etc.
Classified information from authorities and government organizations
personal data like religion or health data

Name: HighlyConfidentialData
Tooltip:

Transmission or forwarding is also only to named recipients and requires the consent of the person responsible for the information.

[Note]:
A leak of this data would cause considerable damage to the company! 

[Examples]:
